#summary superMasterResample
#labels Phase-Support,Help
=USAGE:=
{{{
    superMasterResample superMaster
}}}
=DESCRIPTION:=
  superMasterResample is an internal ADORE command. <br>
  It resamples all crops to a single master image, so that the resulting files can be used to combine interferograms among any pair without resampling. <br>

 If a DEM is available it is equivalent to running:<br>
  `settings apply -r -q int_multilook=\"1 1\" srp_multilook=\"1 1\" crd_include_fe=on;coarseorb;coarsecorr;fine;coregpm;resample;interfero; comprefdem;addrefpha2s_crop`<br>
  
 If a DEM is not available it is equivalent to running:<br>
  `settings apply -r -q int_multilook=\"1 1\" srp_multilook=\"1 1\" srp_dumprefpha=on;coarseorb;coarsecorr;fine;coregpm;resample;interfero; comprefpha;subtrrefpha;addrefpha2s_crop`<br>
    
=INPUT:=
 superMaster: the name of the folder in the data file to be used as the resampling master.

=OUTPUT=
 Creates the `resample` folder inside the `${runFolder}` and resamples all crops listed in `scenes include`
